summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from October to November 2021 between defense attorneys from WilmerHale and a federal prosecutor regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails primarily concern scheduling calls and coordinating the issuance of a trial subpoena to JPMorgan Chase to secure a witness for Maxwell's trial.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale representing or involved in the defense of Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating with prosecutors regarding trial witness logistics and subpoenas.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Attorney from WilmerHale copied on emails regarding the Maxwell case, involved in discussions about trial witnesses.

persons.name: Pat McHugh
persons.context: Individual whom the defense team wishes to set up a call with the prosecutor's team; mentioned as traveling on specific dates.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), which is the subject of all correspondence.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Referred to in a salutation; appears to be a prosecutor (Assistant United States Attorney) corresponding with defense about trial witness matters.

persons.name: Lara
persons.context: Referred to in a salutation alongside Maurene; appears to be a prosecutor corresponding with defense about trial witness matters.

connections.description: Both are attorneys at WilmerHale working together on the Ghislaine Maxwell defense team, as evidenced by being copied on the same emails.
Stoddart (defense) is corresponding with prosecutor Maurene regarding trial logistics and witness subpoenas for the Maxwell case.
Stoddart (defense) is corresponding with prosecutor Lara regarding trial logistics and witness subpoenas for the Maxwell case.
Stoddart is arranging a call between the prosecution and Pat McHugh, who is part of or associated with the defense team.
Stoddart is an attorney from WilmerHale involved in the legal defense of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Jury Selection for Maxwell Trial
events.description: Jury selection is mentioned as being scheduled to be underway the week of November 15, 2021, for the criminal trial of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Coordination for JPMorgan Witness
events.description: Ongoing discussions and coordination between the defense and prosecution to identify a witness from JPMorgan Chase and serve a trial appearance subpoena.

locations: 7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007 (WilmerHale office)
One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007 (Southern District of New York U.S. Attorney's Office)
keyFacts: The defense team for Ghislaine Maxwell, from the law firm WilmerHale, was actively coordinating with federal prosecutors in late 2021 regarding trial logistics.
A key logistical issue involved securing a trial witness from JPMorgan Chase, requiring the prosecution to provide a subpoena.
Jury selection for Maxwell's trial was scheduled to begin in mid-November 2021.
The correspondence shows professional coordination between adversarial legal teams on procedural matters ahead of trial.
The document identifies specific attorneys (Allison Stoddart, Anjan Sahni) and prosecutors (Maurene, Lara) involved in pre-trial preparations.
